basedOn.display: MRI UPPER EXTREM WO/W CONT LT

valueString:
MRI of the left upper extremity, left arm and left forearm


History: Male, 47 years old. Schwannomatosis. Neuropathic pain syndrome. Tumor of soft tissues. Left shoulder pain.


Comparison: None.


Technique: Multiple multiplanar images were obtained of the left upper extremity with and without the use of intravenous MultiHance contrast.


FINDINGS:


Bones and Joints: Normal alignment. No acute fracture. The joint spaces are maintained. Normal bone marrow signal without focal osseous lesion.


Ligaments: Unremarkable.


Tendons: Intact without evidence of tear, tendinosis, or tenosynovitis.


Muscles and Soft tissues: No muscular edema or fatty atrophy partial visualization of several T2 hyperintense masses along the upper thoracic left neural foramina and intercostal regions only seen on coronal images, incompletely evaluated.
